name: I Want to Be a Paper Engineer! Workshop Voucher
description: Perfect for the person who has everything. Click HERE to buy this voucher from The Indytute. An introduction to the joy that is Paper Engineering. In this class Helen Friel will share her expertise and teach you how to design a paper taxidermy fish and then frame your catch of the day. You will design your own fish, and customise the frame to your own specifications. Your mounted fish will then be ready to take home and hang on the wall. So scissors sharpened, shake that glue and get ready to wave your arms.

name: Elbow Grease
description:
As seen in Elle Decoration!

The prevalence of homemade British Elbow Grease in the early 1930s meant that the first batches of Hoake's factory-made product were exported to America. It was an instant hit and is widely credited with ending the Great Depression.

Although the contents of this sealed can have been inexplicably removed it remains a perfect gift for anyone needing a bit of extra oomph.

Handmade paper sculpture
7 x 7 x 7cm

name: Bermuda Triangles
description:
As seen in Elle Decoration!

Rumoured to have originally been developed to combat overcrowding in cities, these risky treats were nonetheless a hit. In 1951 Hoakes issued a press release stating that they believed most of the people inexplicably missing after enjoying the sweets would probably turn up eventually.

Whilst the contents have been removed and destroyed, the Bermuda boxes remain a fun memento of a slightly less safe time.

Handmade paper sculpture
10 x 9 x 3.5cm

name: Forty Winks
description:
As seen in Elle Decoration!

Despite the catastrophic failure of their Sheep Counting Kit, Hoakes & Co were determined to devise a product for insomniacs. Whilst attempting to develop the world's strongest sleeping tablets, Hoakes inadvertently discovered a formula that would guarantee a quick nap, free from grogginess, dry mouth or disorientation. 

It's unsettling side effects mean that the tablets have all been safely disposed of but the classic tin is a must have for anyone who appreciates a snooze. 

Handmade paper sculpture
7 x 7 x 2.5cm

name: Ps & Qs
description:
As seen in Elle Decoration!

Many people have blamed a decline in manners on the internet, television and books. However, it is more likely that this downward spiral is due entirely to the discontinuation of Hoakes & Co.'s Ps & Qs.

Originally designed for wireless presenters, many believe that had Hoakes & Co continued trading drive time radio may have never existed.

Fragile at best, no actual Ps&Qs have survived but their colourful tins serve as a testament to good manners.

Handmade paper sculpture
9.5 x 9.5 x 4cm

name: Midnight Oil
description:
As seen in Elle Decoration!

During the industrial revolution employers were faced with the problem of employees dozing on the job, despite being allowed up to three hours sleep a day. Hoakes & Co jumped at the challenge, developing their now famous Midnight Oil. Burning this in factory lamps upped productively by an astonishing 300% and is single-handily responsible for Britain's thriving textile and coal industries.

A tendency to combust spontaneously has meant that for safety reasons the oil has been drained from the cans. However, the well known design is perfect for anyone who needs a few more hours in the day.

Handmade paper sculpture
7 x 9 x 3cm

name: Hoakes & Co. Gift Set
description:
As seen in Elle Decoration!

A bit of a ditherer? Put aside that pesky free will - the Hoakes & Co. Gift Set is for you! The full Hoakes & Co experience, including Elbow Grease, Midnight Oil, Bermuda Triangles, Ps & Qs and Forty Winks, it contains a solution for all of society's ills.

Although devoid of their original contents these beautiful examples of the Hoakes range are a must for any mantelpiece or desk.

By purchasing the set you save 10% on the full price.
